data.title: Erik Martinez - Baseball
data.meta_description:
Erik Martinez (33) Pitcher  - AS A SENIOR (2018):


	Closed a tremendous Cal career with another impactful season, appearing in 18 games out of the bullpen.
	Went
data.text:
2018 Baseball Roster

Choose a Player:

33 Erik Martinez

Position Pitcher

Height 5-11

Weight 193

Class Senior

Hometown West Covina, Calif.

Last School(s) South Hills HS

Bio

Related

Stats

Historical

Biography

AS A SENIOR (2018):

Closed a tremendous Cal career with another impactful season, appearing in 18 games out of the bullpen.

Went 1-0 with a 4.07 ERA in 24.1 innings pitched. Struck out 28 and limited opposing hitters to a .217 average.

Hit his stride midway through the season and had a five-game stretch of scoreless outings from April 13 to May 1. Tossed 9.2 innings and struck out 17 during the stretch.

Did not allow a run over his final two outings, throwing three scoreless frames at Creighton and another three at Arizona State.

Finished his Cal career with a 12-7 record and 2.89 ERA in 88 appearances. Struck out 152 hitters in 134 innings pitched.

At the time he graduated, ranked in Cal's career top 10 in appearances and saves.

Earned Pac-12 All-Academic honors for the third year in a row, securing the award every year he was eligible.

AS A JUNIOR (2017):

Enjoyed another season as one of the Pac-12's top closers and proved to be one of the conference's more versatile relievers as he went 5-4 with a 3.11 ERA and six saves in 24 appearances

Led the Bears in wins and saves and ranked fourth in the conference in saves

Finished the year tied for sixth on Cal's all-time saves list with 15

Named to both the preseason and midseason Stopper of the Year watch list by the NCBWA

Earned saves against Cal Poly, Pepperdine, Oregon, Arizona State, USC and San Francisco

Delivered one of the most memorable relief outings of the year with 4.2 innings on April 29 at Washington. Earned the victory in Cal's 7-3 win

Added two more impressive stints of long relief down the stretch, starting with four scoreless innings in Cal's 5-3 victory over No. 7 Stanford on May 15. Earned his fifth win of the year eight days later with 3.1 innings of one-run ball at No. 15 Arizona

Held opponents to a .214 batting average

AS A SOPHOMORE (2016):

Appeared in 24 games for the Bears, second-most on the team, and all came in relief

Finished the season with a team-best eight saves, sixth-best in the Pac-12. The eight saves also tied for ninth-best in a single season by a Cal pitcher

On April 23 vs. Arizona, pitched a season-high five innings and set a season-high with seven strikeouts

Posted a 3.13 ERA, third-lowest on the team

Finished the season with a 2.6 k/BB ratio

AS A FRESHMAN (2015):

Was 3-1 with a team-best 1.56 ERA and had 40 strikeouts in 34.2 innings of relief

Struck out eight Anteaters in the second game of a doubleheader on Feb. 21 against UC Irvine in 3.1 innings of work

Earned his first career win with a three inning shutout performance on March 7 vs. Chicago State

Made three relief appearances during the College Station Regional (4.0 IP, 1 R, 0 ER, 4 K's), including a win on May 30 vs. Texas A&M

HIGH SCHOOL/PERSONAL:

Was a Perfect Game 2013 Underclass Honorable Mention selection out of South Hills High School

As a junior was 9-2, earning first-team All-Sierra League honors and was an Academic All-League selection

Undeclared major with an interest in being an orthopedic surgeon

Parents are Xavier and Bertha Martinez

Born March 21, 1996 in West Covina, Calif.

CAREER BESTS

Innings pitched: 5.1, San Francisco, Mar 08, 2014

Walks allowed: 5 [t-4th], Gonzaga, Mar 04, 2017

Strikeouts: 8, UC Irvine, Feb 21, 2015

Batters faced: 23, San Francisco, Mar 08, 2014

Field chances: 3, Cal Poly, Apr 26, 2016

Putouts: 2, Cal Poly, Apr 26, 2016

Assists: 2, 4 times

Runners CS: 2 [t-3rd], at UCLA, Apr 17, 2015; Stanford, May 15, 2017
